# Insert Screen of Clones {#sec-molecular-clone_insert_screen}

## Introduction

-   **Purpose**: This procedure describes how to do an insert screen of clones using PCR.
-   **Procedure Type**: Molecular
-   **Species**:
    -   Threespine stickleback, (*Gasterosteus aculeatus*)
    -   Bay pipefish, (*Syngnathus leptorhyncus*)
    -   Gulf pipefish (*Syngnathus scovelli*)
    -   Zebrafish, (*Danio rerio*)
-   **Author**: Susie Bassham
-   **Date Created**: Unknown

::: {.callout-warning title="Safety"}
**Personal Protective Equipment (PPE):**

- Lab coat
- Safety glasses
- Nitrile gloves

**Biological Safety:**

- Use aseptic technique when handling bacterial cultures
- Dispose of bacterial waste in appropriate biohazard containers
:::

## Materials

-   PCR tubes or plates
-   Pipettes and tips
-   Thermocycler

## Solutions

-   10 µl 2X Turbo (see @sec-molecular-2x_Turbo for recipe)
-   0.1 µl T7 primer
-   0.1 µl M13R primer
-   0.1 µl Taq polymerase
-   7.7 µl npH2O

## Related Protocols

- See @sec-molecular-2x_Turbo for making 2X Turbo mix
- See @sec-molecular-gel for visualizing PCR products
- See @sec-molecular-TopoClone_PCR4 for cloning procedures

## Procedure

### PCR Mix (per reaction)

Mix the following components for each reaction:

-   10 µl 2X Turbo
-   0.1 µl T7 primer
-   0.1 µl M13R primer
-   0.1 µl Taq polymerase
-   7.7 µl npH2O
-   Use toothpick or pipette tip to add small amount of bacterial colony as template

### Thermocycler Program

| Step | Temperature | Time | Cycles |
|------|-------------|------|--------|
| 1    | 94°C        | 5 min | 1x     |
| 2    | 94°C        | 1:15  | 36x    |
| 3    | 55°C        | 1:15  | 36x    |
| 4    | 72°C        | 2:30  | 36x    |
| 5    | 72°C        | 10 min | 1x    |
| 6    | 4°C         | Hold  | -      |

: Thermocycler program for insert screening {#tbl-insert-screen}

After PCR is complete, run products on a gel to visualize inserts (see @sec-molecular-gel).
